item.title: By: Doron Farber
item.dc:creator: Doron Farber
item.description: In MS SQL 2008 and later version the data compression really saves a lot of GB of HD and increases the query performance. Please check this article: <a href="http://dfarber.com/computer-consulting-blog/2011/7/26/data-compression-in-large-tables-in-ms-sql-server.aspx">Data compression in large tables in MS SQL server</a> and see how much GB I saved on a 44GB table.<br />

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: I will write up something later. I would say knowing your data is more important than anything. If you have a PK and it has 6 columns and it is ordered by column1, column2..column 6...this will compress very nicely since the data is ordered it can do dictionary substitutions on the page<br /> <br />
